page.title: 03LOCAL INDUSTRY.
page.content: In an interview on 3/7/85 at the MAGNET SOUTHERNS factory in Widnes,we found that 250 people worked there,50% of whom were women, all live locally. The business has been open for 125 years this year.It makes furniture using timber.It gets it's raw materials from abroad.The factory was set up in Widnes because it was easy to reach other offices around the country.The office manager is head of both safety and personel. They use articulated trucks and boats in the docks to transport goods around.They start work at 8.55am and finish at 5.15pm.They have 3 breaks,one in the morning and one in the afternoon.They also have 50 minutes for dinner.They are allowed 21 days for holidays each year.
